Name: Uncovering Past Heroes
Description:
The clouds above bear witness to echoing battle cries, the wild lands remember the footsteps of warriors, and rushing currents carry the fiery passion of the brave. Here, every corner holds shining tributes to a glorious history. The towering cities, spires, and mighty walls forged by the people of the Septimont stand as enduring proof of their strength and resolve.

At the harbor, you meet a quarreling father and daughter. This unexpected encounter sets you on a journey to uncover the rich history of Septimont...
QuestDesc:
The clouds above bear witness to echoing battle cries, the wild lands remember the footsteps of warriors, and rushing currents carry the fiery passion of the brave. Here, every corner holds shining tributes to a glorious history. The towering cities, spires, and mighty walls forged by the people of the Septimont stand as enduring proof of their strength and resolve.

At the harbor, you meet a quarreling father and daughter. This unexpected encounter sets you on a journey to uncover the rich history of Septimont...

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're... {PlayerName}, the Gladiator who took the champion's crown with contender Lupa!

Options.PlotLineKey: Indeed, 'tis I.
What are you arguing about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm Nicus. Forgive my boldness, but you've arrived at just the right time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As Champion, you must know what it means to be a Gladiator of Septimont. I hope you can persuade her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I once was a Gladiator too. After retiring, I hoped my daughter, Postumia, would carry my mantle, but she's always—

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't want to be a Gladiator! There's no point in talking about it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Postumia makes a face at her father, runs into a crowd, and vanishes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apologies, I didn't mean for you to see this. Whenever I bring this up with her, it always ends in a quarrel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But as I said, perhaps you can persuade her. The title of Champion means a lot to the Septimontians, I believe it means a lot to Postumia as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every time we argue, she storms off to Titanbone Expanse to sulk. I'll message you the coordinates.

Options.PlotLineKey: You're not going to look for her?
Don't you worry something could happen to her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I admit, I often bring up the subject of Gladiators with her, which is why it's not uncommon for Postumia to storm off.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I could go find her, but that would just make things worse. I should give her some time to calm down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Although Postumia does not want to become a Gladiator, she undoubtedly possesses the skills of one. A fact which makes me regret her choice even more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If she could fully commit herself to gladiatorial training, the result would be spectacular.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My rewards may be a trifle for the Champion, but I will still do my best to offer you something for the effort. I just hope Postumia gets back on the right path.

Options.PlotLineKey: And if she insists she doesn't want to be a Gladiator?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I will try other ways. I pray she'll come around one day and accept the honor.

Options.PlotLineKey: I won't force her.
I want to hear her side of the story too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. Whatever you say, your words will leave a lasting impression on her. After all, you are the Champion of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, it's you.... Sorry, I flew off the handle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope you understand. Even though I don't want to be a Gladiator, I've always respected them, especially Champion Gladiators like yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me reintroduce myself. I am Postumia, Septimont's official historian in waiting!

Options.PlotLineKey: Official historian?
So you don't want to be a Gladiator?

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yup, I want to record the annals of Septimont's history and pass them on to future generations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He told you to come here, right? I'm sorry he dragged you into this mess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See, in the beginning, I thought I could just go through the motions of training, and eventually tell him that I don't like his plans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But then he piled on more training sessions, and got it into his head that the Gladiator's path was the only one for me.

Options.PlotLineKey: Because you're naturally talented.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I know. Like I said, I have immense respect for Gladiators. But I don't want to be one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a child, I was captivated by the turbulent history of Septimont. I hoped every visitor here could learn of that difficult and bloody, yet glorious period in time, which embodied the unyielding spirit of our people!

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If only Father would realize—

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, maybe he can! If I can collate all the historical sights of Septimont into one book and show it to Father, he'd understand!

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at where we are now. Titanbone Expanse is where Septimontians first made landfall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stone pillars stand tall here. Rocky outcrops dot the land. Our ancestors felt perfectly at home and in tune with this rugged terrain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is why I come when I'm upset. To gaze at the wilderness and channel the joy that must have surged from our ancestors when they ended their wandering to set foot on this land. In these moments, I feel as if the past is encouraging me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about it? Will you help me take pictures so I can finish my book?  After all, you are our Champion.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Heh, like father like daughter...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Foul tide drowns the peaks, and the great dragon wails in sorrow, pale and withered, it shrouds the land." I read that in a book written by our ancestors. It recounts their discovery of the Ashen Dragon's Crypt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know, we Septimontians like to speak of strength and struggle since they have shaped our history up to modern times.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The dragon before us once nested up in the Border Mountains. When it spread its wings, it blotted out the sky, and its roar was powerful enough to shake the entire island. No one ever questioned its strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But after the Dark Tide washed over it. All that's left is nothing but their remains...

Options.PlotLineKey: Septimont will not share their fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course not! Even when the Dark Tide engulfed Septimont, the waves eventually dashed against the towering, immovable Border Mountains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mountains halted the Dark Tide, but the tide eroded its facade into that ghastly pale shape. Thus, Septimont was spared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you feel it? In times of crisis, not only will the people of Septimont fight to protect this land, but the very land itself will rise to face the menace.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's what makes Septimont so special.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, being praised by a Champion from afar... I can't help but feel a little embarrassed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We built the Vale of Glory to honor the heroes who were felled by the Dark Tide. And neither will we forget the great dragons that were lost to the darkness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For we share this world with dragons. We must remember they once held great power worthy of respect, and let their demise serve as a warning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's leave it at that for now, I want to capture the sacrifice of the Border Mountains in this picture.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now... we'll head to the Mournfell Canyon, it's somewhat of a dangerous place, but nothing we can't handle!

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I was little, my father took me to see this giant statue. He told me how strong this "Hero of Heroes" was and the epic battles he fought in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps he wanted to motivate me to train harder. But I had other plans in my mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Books tell of Fabius, the Hero of Heroes, battling alongside Sentinel Imperator to hold back the Dark Tide. The passages were deeply moving. This statue stands as a perfect testament to Fabius' great deeds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To preserve history is to ensure that future generations will always remember him. Fabius was an incredibly brave warrior, and I…

Dialogues.Speaker: Slovik
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't this lady also a formidable Gladiator? Hello there, I'm Slovik, recently sent by the Black Shores to work at the Dark Tide Observation Tower up on the Border Mountains.

Options.PlotLineKey: I almost forgot you're here as well.
You left the Border Mountains to slack off here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Slovik
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seemed rude to interrupt when the young lady here was having a moment of contemplation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Slovik
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I also like learning about history, and I really love Septimontian culture, so I was over the moon when they told me I'd be sent here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Slovik
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, just sneaking in some free time, you know? I really love Septimontian culture, so I was over the moon when they told me I'd be sent here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Slovik
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I visit the sights whenever I have time. And I'm also going to attend a gladiatorial match during the next public holiday.

Dialogues.Speaker: Slovik
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My love for Septimont has only grown with time, especially since research at the Observation Tower is proceeding smoothly. At the same time, I've come to realize how terrifying the Dark Tide is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Slovik
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which is why I admire Septimont for confronting the Dark Tide head-on. And of course, who could forget the many fearless Gladiators residing in this city, like Miss Postumia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Slovik
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We, too, are trying to support you as best as we can by redoubling our research efforts to understand the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I'm... yes, I'll do my best as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright then, Champion, go ahead and record Fabius, the "Hero of Heroes" who forever watches over the land of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Afterwards, I'll take you to the beating heart of Septimont, Capitoline Hill.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you ready to cross the wilderness with me on our journey to Capitoline Hill?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, let's get going.
I need some time to prepare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright! The greenery of Capitoline Hill await us!

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No problem! I'll meet you there when you're ready.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Septimont City, Capitoline Hill, Gryphon's Fortress. This place goes by many names, just as it embodies the many qualities of the Septimontians.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Outsiders who don't understand Septimont view us as proud and overbearing, much like the city's skyline from afar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But once they get to know us, they see that our passion burns like the sun, and our honor shines just as brightly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter where you're from, you're always welcome to join us in the prosperous and vibrant heart of Septimont.

Options.PlotLineKey: I familiar with the city's hospitality.
I know, I'm already a Septimontian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Familiar with city's hospitality?" You're our champion! Of course you're a Septimontian!

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most definitely. The Champion is the Septimontian who represents our values!

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have all lived through Septimont's past hardships, and now this magnificent city bastion stands as a testament to our glorious future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A "future" that is mine to record, which in time will turn into the "past" that our descendants will look up to. Such is my work as a historian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But… will it be enough? If crisis lurks in Septimont's "future," the city will need more warriors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If so… am I just wasting my talent, like Father said? When that time comes, will I be left with nothing but regret?

Options.PlotLineKey: You don't have to bear that heavy burden.
What matters is doing what you want.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for comforting me, Champion. But my father, he—

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for comforting me, Champion… but I'm lost. Should I be a Gladiator or a historian, I just—

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Did you hear a strange noise?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yeah, sounds like a big pair of ears flapping.
You have a keen sense of hearing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As expected of the Champion, you heard Ta-da's swooshing sound right away!

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Gladiator must keep their eyes sharp and ears open, especially when it comes to Echoes. That swoosh must have been made by Ta-da's flapping wings, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That little thing probably got lost. I guess it likes noisy places. If there's no one around, it must have become scared. Let's go find it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings, Champion. The two of you did an entire lap around Septimont. Good work.

Options.PlotLineKey: Oh, how we soared across the land.
It's a fruitful voyage of knowledge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, I must sincerely thank you, especially for the photos you captured and the stories Postumia shared. I never realized the richness of Septimont's history before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every Septimontian knows about those hard years, but what Postumia said about recording our "future" so that it may become the "past" which our descendants will look up to—that truly moved me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her talents go beyond fighting. If being a historian brings her joy, then I must support her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But… Father, I now understand that being a Gladiator carries with it the warrior spirit of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Along the way, I've realized how passionate the people of Septimont are for their Gladiators. I can't just abandon the path now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The changes in me and Postumia wouldn't have been possible without your help. So, do you think she ought to be a Gladiator or a historian?

Options.PlotLineKey: A Gladiator is free to do what they want.
Being a Gladiator is more flexible than you imagine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Free...? Champion, you are right, a Gladiator has the freedom of choice!

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... I should be a Gladiator?

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I get it. You're telling me the path of a Gladiator isn't a be-all and end-all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can be a Gladiator, and much more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can be a Gladiator-historian!

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Postumia... does this mean you'll keep up with gladiatorial training?

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, if I can do well at both, why should I give up on one?

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though the path may be arduous, we Septimontians tackle challenges head-on. It's what we do, right, Champion?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, warrior-scholar!
You're already an excellent Gladiator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, you're right! Maybe I'll even become the talk of Septimont. If I do step into the arena, you'd better cheer for me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, if you put it like that, I might get too big for my britches. You'd better cheer for me when I step into the arena!

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In any case, Champion, again, you have my gratitude.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for accompanying me to all the places I wanted to visit, and thank you for helping me to find the path forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's take one last photo of the Colosseum. May the glory and applause which echo within their walls always be with you.
Oh no....

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hang in there! We're here to help!

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your hard work.

Options.PlotLineKey: I knew you were tailing us this whole time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's hard to keep secrets from the Champion, but I was so worried about my daughter, I had to find her. I'm sorry she took you on a walking history course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nevertheless, now that you've seen Postumia in action, you must admit it'd be a waste if she doesn't step into the arena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She who loves Septimont so much would best leave her mark on its history as a Gladiator.

Options.PlotLineKey: I wasn't the only one she took around Septimont.
Haven't you paid any attention to her feelings?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not the only one? You mean—she knew I was following her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew she felt a career in history—wait. Does she know I'm following her?

Options.PlotLineKey: Those stories she told were for you to hear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those stories... about Septimont's history?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I see. Champion, may I continue following Postumia? And please, don't tell her we spoke.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nicus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need some time to think, and I'd like to finish her journey with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Postumia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To reach the Statue of Fabius the Hero, we must first cross this sea. It's not a short trip, so let's set out now!

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, let's get going.
I need some time to prepare.
